newsitem.title: USA: Meditrust modifies Santa Anita offer.
newsitem.headline: Meditrust modifies Santa Anita offer.

text.p: Meditrust said Friday it modified its previously announced merger agreement with Santa Anita Cos, allowing it to buy Santa Anita shares at current market prices instead of at $31 a share.
Meditrust also said it plans to buy in open-market and privately-negotiated transactions up to 9.8 percent of the current outstanding shares of Santa Anita.

Under the modified agreement, Meditrust will still be required to fulfill its previously announced obligation to buy 9.8 percent of Santa Anita shares by buying newly-issued shares or shares currently outstanding on the open market.

This change does not affect Meditrust's obligation to make a total of $100 million available to Santa Anita for a cash-election by its shareholders for about 3.2 million Santa Anita common shares at $31 per share, or Meditrust's right to designate one or more unaffiliated purchasers to acquire up to an additional 19.6 percent of newly issued shares at $31 per share, the company said.
Meditrust also filed a modification on May 19. A spokeswoman said that modification allowed unnamed third parties to buy shares of Santa Anita.
